title: My location in Firefox is incorrect
content: Any time I allow a website to use my location on my home computer, it places me in a suburb in Las Vegas. However, I live near Seattle. This happens on multiple websites including Google Maps and Uber Eats, and on other browsers my location is correct. I'm not running any VPNs or proxy servers, I've verified that my IP address is linked to my correct location, and I've deleted all cache and cookies ("Everything" for time frame) from my history. Is there a way I can have an accurate location again?

title: Reclaim Lost Bitcoin, USDT, and Ethereum Investment from Scam by CryptoChain Global Track
content:
Cryptocurrency has opened up a new frontier in digital finance, offering individuals control over their assets like never before. However, with this freedom comes the growing risk of fraud. Every day, investors fall victim to fake trading platforms, fraudulent investment schemes, and sophisticated online scams that result in the loss of valuable digital assets such as Bitcoin, USDT, and Ethereum.

If you‚Äôve been affected by a crypto scam, it's important to know that reclaiming your lost investment is not out of reach. CryptoChain Global Track is a trusted recovery service that specializes in helping victims trace and recover stolen or fraudulently transferred cryptocurrency.

CryptoChain Global Track combines advanced blockchain forensics with professional investigative techniques to locate and follow the movement of lost assets across the decentralized web. Their team includes blockchain analysts, cybersecurity experts, and digital forensics specialists who understand how scammers operate‚Äîand more importantly, how to counteract their methods.

Whether you lost funds through a Ponzi scheme, impersonation scam, hacked wallet, or fraudulent DeFi platform, CryptoChain Global Track can assess your case and develop a tailored recovery plan. They begin by reviewing all available information, including wallet addresses, transaction IDs, and communications. Then, using powerful tracing tools, they follow the trail of your assets and identify possible recovery points.

What makes CryptoChain Global Track stand out is their transparency and integrity. They do not guarantee miracles‚Äîbut they do offer honest, data-driven assessments of each case. If there's a chance to reclaim your funds, they'll pursue it aggressively and professionally, while keeping you informed every step of the way.

If you‚Äôve lost Bitcoin, USDT, Ethereum, or any other digital asset due to a scam, don‚Äôt give up. You may still have a chance to recover what‚Äôs rightfully yours.

To get started with a consultation, contact CryptoChain Global Track:

Email: cryptochainglobaltrack@cryptochain.co.site Website: ccgtonline.com WhatsApp: +44 (776) 876-1569

With the right expertise, recovery is possible. Let CryptoChain Global Track help you take that first step.

title: Can we make the 'group tabs' feature OFF by default and allow users to activate it if they want?
content:
With the recent update, the 'group tabs' feature was added. Myself and many other users discovered this when tabs become grouped when we don't want them to, and we need to deal with the visual clutter or right click and ungroup them.

The frustrating thing comes from how easy it is to group tabs accidentally. Simply dragging and moving tabs around (which is a regular part of how I mentally organize what I'm doing) will often group tabs.

Weirdly, you can grab a tab A, move it around tab B and it is possible to place tab B in a group by itself having done nothing except move around tab A with the mouse. The UI functionality of initiating the tab group still needs work. It's somewhat intuitive when you know about it and want it.

I don't dislike the grouping feature, I dislike that it is unintentional 99% of the time and it is way too easy to do accidentally. This feature should NOT be enabled by default, and it should have a toggle in the settings to easily turn it off.

title: YouTube video pauses after closing Picture-in-Picture (PiP) mode
content:
Hello,

I'm experiencing an issue with YouTube video playback in Firefox. When I watch a video in Picture-in-Picture (PiP) mode and then close the PiP window, the video automatically pauses on the main tab in the browser.

My expectation is for the video to continue playing in the background tab after the PiP window is closed, similar to how it works, for example, in Opera GX browser.

I have already tried changing the media.videocontrols.picture-in-picture.pause-on-disable setting to false in about:config, but this did not resolve the issue. The video still pauses.

I believe it would be a significant convenience if Firefox allowed videos to continue playing in the background rather than pausing them when the PiP window is closed.

Is there any way to fix it?

Dear Google Support Team,

I am writing to report an issue with the Google Maps listing of our website, https://www.navjyotifoundationindia.com. The contact number is not displaying on the listing, which is affecting our ability to assist individuals seeking immediate help for addiction recovery. This missing information is causing inconvenience to users and impacting our outreach efforts. Thank you. Navjyoti Foundation India

title: Issue with Video Playback Performance on Firefox
content:
Hi Mozilla Community,

I‚Äôve been experiencing some issues with video playback on Firefox, specifically on YouTube. Videos seem to always play in a choppy manner, no matter the quality settings. I‚Äôve tried clearing the cache and updating Firefox, but the issue persists. I‚Äôve also checked my internet speed, and it's stable, so I'm not sure where the problem lies.

Has anyone else faced this issue? Any suggestions on what might be causing the choppy playback or how to fix it?

To give some context, I was also recently looking at how efficient high-speed trains operate around the world, and came across a fascinating comparison of the top 10 fastest trains in India. Just like video streaming, maintaining high performance and smooth operation is key ‚Äî it made me realize how even small optimizations in streaming might have a big impact on the experience.

I appreciate any help or insights from the community!

Thank you!

title: Pages freezing & high CPU usage when reading Solo Leveling manga online ‚Äî Firefox issue?
content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôve been trying to read Solo Leveling manga on several popular sites, but I keep running into this issue on Firefox:

Pages freeze or become unresponsive

CPU usage spikes really high when scrolling through image-heavy chapters

Sometimes the tab crashes or lags badly, especially on mobile

I‚Äôm using an ad blocker, but I think the sites are loaded with scripts and popups that make it worse.

To fix it, I even built my own lightweight site for the series: üëâ sololevelingmangafree.online which seems to work smoothly because it‚Äôs just clean HTML and images.

content: I work with healthcare personal remotely. I was not aware of the license Ive had on personal email accounts that were linked and submitted for data. title: I once used a website for support for my mental health. I can no longer use the website.
content: I once used a website for support for my mental health. There is no other website like it, and I would not be here today without it. For several years now, I've attempted to re-access the website. I have even gotten to the final page (which is rare) but when I click on the "I hereby consent" button - nothing, just errors. I've added the main website and the page site that will not load to all exceptions of all privacy settings I have switched on, but nothing. To be honest, I can't tell if it is Firefox or not, as other browsers give me the exact same issues. I have ADHD and reading, and making sense of the various solutions seems impossible. I cannot even access the website with all other antivirus & malware software, VPN or any other security software and extensions turned off. Remedying this feels hopeless. How can I get assistance? I only wish to sign back up but I can't. I do not believe it is the website creating the issue. I have screenshots showing the error pages, how do I send diagnostic data to you so you might be able to help?
creator: noncompliant

title: unstoppable fraudulent Trust Wallet add-ins
content: What's up with this? Two fake Trust Wallet add-ins were disabled within the last couple of days after one stole my money and I reported it, and another similar one. They had been pinned to my toolbar and they were subsequently taken off from there with the message that they had violated Mozilla's policies. Now I see that again there are two of them. How can this be prevented? The most obvious sign that these are fake is when one goes to create a new wallet the add-in directs the user to import instead, i.e. it wants to steal private information like recovery phrase.
creator: pdreyfuss

title: Firefox Keeps Pooping Out
content:
I use a MacBook Air running on Sequoia 15.5. Firefox was updated several days ago to 140.0.2 (aarch64).

Since yesterday, Firefox has repeatedly stopped running. (It might have started sooner, but I didn't use the computer over the long weekend.) It won't load pages. Sometimes I get the spinning wheel. Usually, I have to force quit.

I've cleared the cache, restarted the browser, and restarted the computer repeatedly. Restarting the computer sometimes helps. Now is not one of those times.

Also, the About Firefox window is open, and the Checking for updates . . . wheel keeps spinning.

There are no connectivity issues otherwise with my computer or other apps.

Does anyone know why this is happening? Do I need to go back to the last version of Firefox? Uninstall/reinstall?
